member.name: T:Sirenix.Serialization.DataFormat
member.summary: Specifies a data format to read and write in.

member.name: F:Sirenix.Serialization.DataFormat.Binary
member.summary: A custom packed binary format. This format is most efficient and almost allocation-free, but its serialized data is not human-readable.

member.name: F:Sirenix.Serialization.DataFormat.JSON
member.summary:
A JSON format compliant with the json specification found at "http://www.json.org/".
This format has rather sluggish performance and allocates frightening amounts of string garbage.

member.name: F:Sirenix.Serialization.DataFormat.Nodes
member.summary:
A format that does not serialize to a byte stream, but to a list of data nodes in memory which can then be serialized by Unity.
This format is highly inefficient, and is primarily used for ensuring that Unity assets are mergeable by individual values when saved in Unity's text format. This makes serialized values more robust and data recovery easier in case of issues.
This format is *not* recommended for use in builds.

member.name: T:Sirenix.Serialization.DefaultLoggers
member.summary: Defines default loggers for serialization and deserialization. This class and all of its loggers are thread safe.

member.name: T:Sirenix.Serialization.ErrorHandlingPolicy
member.summary: The policy for handling errors during serialization and deserialization.

member.name: F:Sirenix.Serialization.ErrorHandlingPolicy.Resilient
member.summary: Attempts will be made to recover from errors and continue serialization. Data may become invalid.

member.name: F:Sirenix.Serialization.ErrorHandlingPolicy.ThrowOnErrors
member.summary: Exceptions will be thrown when errors are logged.

member.name: F:Sirenix.Serialization.ErrorHandlingPolicy.ThrowOnWarningsAndErrors
member.summary: Exceptions will be thrown when warnings or errors are logged.
